intro: Epilobium alsinifolium subsp. parviflorum, commonly known as narrow-leaved willowherb, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows, riverbanks, and woodland edges. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers with pinkish to reddish petals. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. It is a flowering plant in the family Onagraceae, known for its ecological importance to pollinators.
